com.uno.dbbc.checkers

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.uno.dbbc.checkers.Board
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A class representing a Board in Checker.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board()
        Creates an instance of Board. Sets up the pieces as in freshly started game.

    • Method Detail

      • initialBoardSetup

        public void initialBoardSetup()
        Sets up the board in initial configuration i.e puts the pieces in places where they should be when starting the game

      • getCell

        public Cell getCell(int x,
                    int y)
             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Gets the Cell in the specified position
        Parameters:
        x - x-coordinate of the cell
        y - y-coordinate of the cell
        Returns:
        the instance of Cell in the position specified by given x-coordinate and y-coordinate
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given x-coordinate and y-coordinate is out of bound i.e not in range 0 <= x, y <= 7

      • getPieces

        public java.util.ArrayList<Piece> getPieces(java.lang.String givenColor)
                                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Returns an ArrayList of pieces of the specified color
        Parameters:
        givenColor - The color of the pieces that is to be retrieved.
        Returns:
        ArrayList of the pieces of the specified color that are in the board currently
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the specified color is not a valid color i.e if the specified color is not one of Piece.LIGHT or Piece.DARK

      • movePiece

        public java.util.ArrayList<Cell> movePiece(int fromX,
                                           int fromY,
                                           int toX,
                                           int toY)
                                    throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                                           java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Moves the piece from one cell to another cell in the board. This method does not checks if the given move is valid or not.
        Parameters:
        fromX - The x-coordinate of the source cell i.e the cell from where the piece is to be moved.
        fromY - The y-coordinate of the source cell.
        toX - The x-coordinate of the destination cell i.e. the cell where the piece is to be placed.
        toY - The y-coordinate of the destination cell.
        Returns:
        Returns an ArrayList of Cell that were changed by the move. If the move did not involve any capture then the returned ArrayList will contain the source and destination Cells only. However, if the move comprised of a capture, then the returned ArrayList will contain the source Cell, destination Cell and the Cell in which the captured Piece was located.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the source Cell does not contains any Piece.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given x and y coordinates are out of bound (i.e 0 <= x, y <= 7) or if the destination cell contains a Piece

      • movePiece

        public java.util.ArrayList<Cell> movePiece(int[] src,
                                           int[] dst)
                                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Moves the piece from one cell to another cell in the board. This method does not checks if the given move is valid or not. This method calls movePiece(int fromX, int fromY, int toX, int toY) with arguments src[0], src[1], dst[0] and dst[1] respectively.
        Parameters:
        src - An integer array of length two representing the coordinate of source Cell i.e. src[0] = x-coordinate of source Cell and src[1] = y-coordiante of source Cell
        dst - An integer array of length two representing the coordinate of destination Cell i.e. dst[0] = x-coordinate of destination Cell and dst[1] = y-coordiante of destination Cell
        Returns:
        Returns an ArrayList of Cell that were changed by the move. If the move did not involve any capture then the returned ArrayList will contain the source and destination Cells only. However, if the move comprised of a capture, then the returned ArrayList will contain the source Cell, destination Cell and the Cell in which the captured Piece was located.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the length of the parameters is not equal to two i.e. if src.length != 2 || dst.length != 2;

      • movePiece

        public java.util.ArrayList<Cell> movePiece(int[] move)
                                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Moves the piece from one cell to another cell in the board. This method does not checks if the given move is valid or not. This method calls movePiece(int fromX, int fromY, int toX, int toY) with arguments move[0], move[1], move[2] and move[3] respectively.
        Parameters:
        move - An integer array of length four representing the move i.e.
        move[0] = x-coordinate of the source Cell,
        move[1] = y-coordiante of the source Cell,
        move[2] = x-coordinate of the destination Cell,
        move[3] = y-coordinate of the destination Cell
        Returns:
        Returns an ArrayList of Cell that were changed by the move. If the move did not involve any capture then the returned ArrayList will contain the source and destination Cells only. However, if the move comprised of a capture, then the returned ArrayList will contain the source Cell, destination Cell and the Cell in which the captured Piece was located.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the length of the parameters is not equal to two i.e. if src.length != 2 || dst.length != 2;

      • removePiece

        public void removePiece(Piece capturedPiece)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Removes the given Piece from the board.
        Parameters:
        capturedPiece - The Piece to be removed
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the piece was not successfully removed
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • possibleMoves

        public java.util.ArrayList<Cell> possibleMoves(int x,
                                               int y)
                                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Returns the possible moves that the Piece located in the given coordinate can have. This method calls possibleMoves(Cell givenCell) with the Cell returned by the method getCell(x, y) of the Board class as the parameter.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate of the Cell in which the required Piece is located.
        y - The x-coordinate of the Cell in which the required Piece is located.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of Cell where the Piece in the given location can move. If there is no Piece in the given location then the returned ArrayList is empty.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the coordinates are out of bound i.e. not in range 0<= x, y <=7

      • possibleMoves

        public java.util.ArrayList<Cell> possibleMoves(Cell givenCell)
                                        throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Returns the possible moves that the Piece in given Cell can have.
        Parameters:
        givenCell - The Cell associated with the Piece whose possible moves is to be determined
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of Cell where the Piece in the given Cell can move. If there is no Piece in the given Cell then the returned ArrayList is empty.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given Cell is null i.e. givenCell == null.

      • possibleMoves

        public java.util.ArrayList<Cell> possibleMoves(Piece givenPiece)
                                        throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Returns the possible moves that the given Piece can have. This method calls possibleMoves(Cell givenCell) with the Cell object returned by givenPiece.getCell() as a parameter.
        Parameters:
        givenPiece - The Piece whose possible move is to be determined
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of Cell where the given Piece can move.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given Piece is null i.e. givenPiece == null.

      • getCaptureMoves

        public java.util.ArrayList<Cell> getCaptureMoves(Cell givenCell)
                                          throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Returns the capturing moves of the Piece located in the provided Cell.
        Parameters:
        givenCell - The Cell where the Piece, whose capturing moves is to be determined, is located.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of Cell where the Piece in given Cell can move and also captures the opponent's piece when performing those moves. If there is no Piece in the given Cell or if the Piece in given Cell does not have any capturing moves then the returned ArrayList is empty.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the given Cell is null.

      • getCaptureMoves

        public java.util.ArrayList<Cell> getCaptureMoves(int x,
                                                 int y)
                                          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Returns the capture moves of the Piece located in the Cell with given x and y coordinates. This method calls the method getCaptureMoves(Cell givenCell) with the Cell object returned by getCell(x, y) (method of the Board class) as argument.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate of the Cell where the Piece, whose capture moves is to be determined, is located.
        y - The y-coordinate of the Cell where the Piece, whose capture moves is to be determined, is located.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of Cell where the Piece located in given coordinates can move and also captures the opponent's piece when performing those moves. If there is no Piece in the Cell with given coordinates or if the Piece in the Cell with given coordinates does not have any capturing moves, then the returned ArrayList is empty.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the coordinates are out of bound i.e. not in range 0<= x, y <=7

      • isCaptureMove

        public boolean isCaptureMove(Cell srcCell,
                             Cell dstCell)
                      throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                             java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Returns whether the given pair of Cell can form a capture move. This method does not check if the destination Cell is a valid move for Piece in source Cell. Therefore, make sure that the destination Cell is from the list given by possibleMoves(...) method applied to source Cell.
        Parameters:
        srcCell: - The source Cell of the move.
        dstCell: - The destination Cell of the move.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if source Cell and/or destination Cell is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if source Cell does not contain any piece.

      • isCaptureMove

        public boolean isCaptureMove(int[] givenMove)
                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Returns if the given coordinates form a capture move. This method does not check if the given move is a valid move or not. This method calls isCaptureMove(Cell srcCell, Cell dstCell) as isCaptureMove(getCell(givenMove[0], givenMove[1]) , getCell(givenMove[2], givenMove[3]))
        Parameters:
        givenMove - An integer array of size 4 such that:
        givenMove[0] = x-coordinate of the source Cell
        givenMove[1] = y-coordinate of the source Cell
        givenMove[2] = x-coordinate of the destination Cell
        givenMove[3] = y-coordinate of the destination Cell
        Returns:
        Returns if the given Cell is the capturing move of the given Piece.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the coordinates are out of bound i.e. not in range [0, 7] inclusive
